commit.message: fix compatibility with flake8 > 3.7

Make this properly build, and test on Python 3.8

from_parent() will only take 2 arguments, so make the rest optional
when setting them manually.

Also add Python 3.8 to platforms we run tests on.

Bump version.

commit.message:
Update Readme to fix setup.cfg 

Using [pytest] in setup.cfg with these package versions:

    python 3.7.2
    pytest==4.4.2
    pytest-flake8==1.0.4
    pytest-runner==4.4 

led to this error message:

_Failed: [pytest] section in setup.cfg files is no longer supported, change to [tool:pytest] instead._

I've changed the README from [pytest] to [tool:pytest] .

verification.payload:
tree c47f759609b508039c966d3617cca10dc07e39e7
parent c485d5e85ac6b2138405378e9763e7025f58b023
author Jeff Hale <discdiver@users.noreply.github.com> 1558385148 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1558385148 -0400

Using [pytest] in setup.cfg with these package versions:

    python 3.7.2
    pytest==4.4.2
    pytest-flake8==1.0.4
    pytest-runner==4.4 

led to this error message:

_Failed: [pytest] section in setup.cfg files is no longer supported, change to [tool:pytest] instead._

I've changed the README from [pytest] to [tool:pytest] .

commit.message:
Correctly specify Python version for xdist

Don't tell pip to use Python 3.6 while at the same time telling
Travis to use Python 2.6 -- that does not work so well.

For the Xenial images it is no longer enough to just ask for "pypy"
and "pypy3", respectively -- ask for "pypy2.7-6.0" and "pypy3.5-6.0"

Use xenial for Python 3.7 support

Switch Travis CI to Xenial image for Python 3.7 support, and update
the list of environments to test.

Bump to version 1.0.3

Put in some fixes and bump to version 1.0.3

Fix a new test failure

This one is really confusing and may need to be revisited -- it
will give an error about missing newline as well as extra newline
at end of file!

Fix issues with current tox

Make it work with current tox, should fix Travis CI issues as well.
Switch some things to use Python 3.6 instead of 2.7.

Actually run CI tests on Python 3.7

Add Python 3.7 to the list of environments to check with Travis CI.

Don't use deprecated function name

This was deprecated a long time ago, back in 3.0.x, so switch to the
current name now that it has actually been removed in pytest 4.x...

Fix typo

There is no option "--m MARKER", it it "-m MARKER", so make sure we
only use one dash for that...
Document changes

Properly quote a regex string

Make sure we specify a regex string with r"" so that escape
sequences are handled correctly.

Fixes #49

Add Python 3.7 to environments

Make sure we test on Python 3.7 as well, now that it has been
released.

pytest 3.5.0 changed how node identifiers are handled

With node identifiers now being statically created, make sure
we change it at construction time and not expect to specify an
override every time it is looked up.

Fixes #45

Release 1.0.0

Release new version with a couple of fixes, as well as correcting
tests with current version of pytest.

Properly test for marker

Use --mflake8 when testing for (and expecting failure with --strict)
that marker has not been properly registered.
